meanings.sent1: She kept redefying the word until she understood it clearly.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is redefying the instructions for the students.
meanings.sent3: By redefying the recipe, she accidentally made a new dish.
meanings.sent4: His unique perspective on life redefies the norm.
meanings.sent5: Redefying the rules made the game more exciting.

meanings.definition: To give a new or different definition to
meanings.sent1: The author is redefying the characters in the story.
meanings.sent2: They are redefying the concept of beauty in their art.
meanings.sent3: Redefying the word 'boring' to mean 'interesting' is confusing.
meanings.sent4: Her bold fashion choices redefy the traditional style.
meanings.sent5: Redefying the term 'success' can lead to personal growth.

meanings.definition: To change or alter the meaning of
meanings.sent1: The advertisement is redefying the product to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often redefy their promises to fit new situations.
meanings.sent3: Redefying the warning signs can have serious consequences.
meanings.sent4: His actions redefy the trust others had in him.
meanings.sent5: Redefying history can shape the future in unexpected ways.
